page.title: 02WEST BECKTON WALK (1)
page.content: On a warm afternoon the domesday project group went out for a walk round the West Beckton Area. We looked at all the new houses. Before thw houses were built there were ditches across the marsh land. This was used for grazing cattle up to Victorian times. There were lots of new houses in Stansfield Road. There was a dead-end called Alison Road with men building new houses. On the left hand-side of Stansfield Road was a golf course. Then we walked further up Stansfield Road to see the horses. The gates of the horses field were not open because the horses were wild. We looked behind the fence on the corner of Stansfield Road. And there were more workmen biulding more houses. We then went back to school.
